summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20-CR-330). The order addresses the government's motion to preclude testimony from six of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense. The court grants the motion to preclude as to Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman, and orders the parties to propose any redactions to the sealed opinions and moving papers.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, granting in part the government's motion to preclude expert testimony.

persons.name: Dr. Ryan Hall
persons.context: An expert witness noticed by the defense whose testimony the government moved to preclude; the court granted the motion to preclude his testimony.

persons.name: Bennett Gershman
persons.context: An expert witness noticed by the defense whose testimony the government moved to preclude; the court granted the motion to preclude his testimony.

connections.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Dr. Ryan Hall was an expert witness noticed by the defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Bennett Gershman was an expert witness noticed by the defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Notices Expert Witnesses
events.description: The defense for Ghislaine Maxwell noticed eight expert witnesses.

events.title: Government Files Motion to Preclude
events.description: The government filed a motion to preclude the testimony of six of the eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense.

events.title: Defense Files Response
events.description: The defense filed a response to the government's motion to preclude expert testimony.

events.title: Court Issues Order on Motion to Preclude
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order granting the government's motion to preclude the testimony of defense experts Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court granted the government's motion to preclude testimony from two of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense experts: Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman.
The defense had originally noticed eight expert witnesses on November 1, 2021.
The court's memorandum opinions and orders on the motion were temporarily filed under seal, with the parties ordered to propose any necessary redactions.
The legal standard for sealing or redaction referenced is the three-part test from the Second Circuit case Lugosch v. Pyramid Co. of Onondaga.
